results.title: Dazed and confused
results.creator_credit: Richard Linklater, Sean Daniel, James Jacks and Gramercy Pictures
results.brief_description: Taking place on the last day of school in 1974 this coming-of-age comedy drama is a interesting look at 70’s youth culture. From nerds to footballers this story follows students seeking fun involving the usual booze, drugs and parties within a random storyline. Not just the usual teen flick “Dazed and Confused” is seen as a realist portrayal of the teenage years where a party is the main destination. Cast includes Milla Jovovich, Jason London, Joey Lauren Adams, Ben Affleck, Matthew McConaughey and Parker Posey.

results.title: Mission: impossible
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Cruise/Wagner and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Tom Cruise stars in this high action remake of the television series. The film is an action packed, gadget filled blockbuster with twisting plots, glamour and double crossing secret agents. “Mission: Impossible” is a big-production exciting spy thriller. Cast includes Jon Voight, Emmanuelle Beart, Henry Czerny, Jean Reno, Kristin Scott-Thomas and Vanessa Redgrave.

results.title: The Lawnmower man
results.creator_credit: Brett Leonard, Gimel Everett, Fuji Eight, Lane Pringle Productions, Allied Vision and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A brilliant scientist, obsessed with perfecting a revolutionary virtual reality software program, enlists the aid of a slow-witted gardener, only to encounter a shadowy group seeking to turn the “lawnmower man” into the ultimate weapon. Stars Pierce Brosnan with Jeff Fahey, Jenny Wright, Mark Bringleson, Geoffrey Lewis.

constellations_other.name: Future forward; cyberpunk manifestations, fantasy and world building
constellations_other.description: Science fiction and cyberpunk are often powerful projections of the future, which may act as dystopic warnings or strive for an optimistic outcome where societies rise above adversity.

results.title: Mother night
results.creator_credit: Keith Gordon, Robert B Weide and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Based on a novel by Kurt Vonnegut “Mother Night” follows the story of an American playwright (Nick Nolte) living in Germany during WWII. He is approached by a US agent to become a spy. By broadcasting coded Nazi propaganda on the radio he is able to pass on allied information. During this time he seems to be a convincing Nazi. With only a few knowing his true beliefs he finds himself helpless in Israel on trial for war crimes. A moody story of assumed identity and a man alone in a strange world. Cast includes Alan Arkin, Kristen Dunst, John Goodman and an appearance of Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

results.title: Grosse Pointe blank
results.creator_credit: George Armitage, Donna Roth, Roger Birnbaum, Susan Arnold and Buena Vista
results.brief_description: Hilariously black romantic comedy about a hit man who returns to his home town and attends his high school reunion. Encountering a former flame, who he unceremoniously jilted several years earlier, Martin is caught between his dark past (that has followed him home) and his desire for something new with Debbie. Top cast includes John and Joan Cusack, Alarn Arkin, Minnie Driver and Dan Ackroyd.

results.title: Crooklyn
results.creator_credit: Spike Lee, Child Hoods Productions, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Make yourself at home with the Carmichael family as they experience one very special summer in their Brooklyn neighborhood that they’ve affectionately nicknamed ‘Crooklyn’. Alfre Woodard stars as a loving, but fiercely independent mother who along with her musician husband Woody (Delroy Lindo) struggles to raise her family in difficult but often wonderful circumstances. Cast also includes David Patrick Kelly, Jose Zuniga, Isaiah Washington, Ivelka Reyes, Spike Lee, N. Jeremi Duru and Zelda Harris.

results.title: Cop land
results.creator_credit: James Mangold, Ezra Swerdlow, Cathy Konrad, Gary Woods, Miramax Films and Woods Entertainment
results.brief_description: Freddy Heflin is a simple, small-town sheriff whose life is about to change. After he uncovers evidence of murder, faked suicide and police tampering, Freddy must choose between the man he idolizes, the woman he adores and the law he’s sworn to defend. Cast includes Sylvester Stallone, Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta, Robert de Niro.

results.title: Absolute power
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Karen Spiegel, Malpaso Company and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Absolute Power is a political thriller about a retiring thief who witnesses a murder - by the President of the United States. Fearing that he will be blamed, the thief plans to flee the country - after making amends with his estranged daughter - but decides instead to stay and fight the hypocrisy. Masterfully directed (and starring) Clint Eastwood, this paranoid conspiracy crime story bristles with suspense and features an all impressive cast that includes Gene Hackman, Ed Harris, Laura Linney, Scott Glenn, Dennis Haysbert, E.G. Marshall and Judy Davis.

results.title: Pink Floyd: Pulse
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Lana Topham, Pink Floyd (1987) Ltd and Picture Music International (PMI)
results.brief_description: Recorded live at Earls Court, London on October 20th, 1994. This is classic Pink Floyd performing some of their best known music including “Learning to fly”, “Another brick in the wall”, “Money”, “Us and them”, and “Comfortably numb”. Features David Gilmour, Nick Mason and Richard Wright with Sam Brown, Claudia Fontaine, Durga McBroom on backing vocals, Jon Carin on keyboard and vocals, Dick Parry on saxophone, Tim Renwick on guitars and vocals and Gary Wallis on percussion.

results.title: Mission: impossible 2
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Paula Wagner, Tom Cruise, Wagner Production and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Visually charged action-packed sequel to the 1996 original, “Mission Impossible 2”, directed by John Woo, has all the kinetic thrills expected from a master of the genre, but a simplified script leaves it strangely lacking in tension. Tom Cruise reprises his role as Ethan Hunt, the daredevil spy, who falls for a former flame of a spy turned bad. Hunt must rescue his new love, and save the world from a deadly virus. Supporting cast includes Thandie Newton (as the love interest) and Dougray Scott (as the villain).
